medium: Color lithograph and screenprint on a heavy paper envelope containing one 7-inch vinyl recording disc with color xerographed labels within a paper sleeve
title: Remembrance of Marcel
marks:
Signature; Edition; Inscriptions

see Signed

 Signed in black ink, LR: [G. Segal]
text: Part of a multi-artist portfolio project, George Segal's 45 RPM vinyl record and sleeve documents the artist's personal memories of the influential avant-garde artist Marcel Duchamp, who died in 1968. Segal's admiration for Duchamp was returned by the older artist, who observed that "With Segal, it's not a matter of the found object, it's the chosen object."
creditline: The Miscellaneous Works of Art Purchase Fund
